paper_abstract: In spread spectrum (SS) based watermarking, the watermark sequence is often shaped by using a host-dependent perceptual model and can not be accurately recovered at the receiver, resulting in watermark decoding with unmatched filtering, where the reference sequence at the watermark decoder does not match with the embedded sequence. In this paper, the improved SS (ISS) modulation is extended to cancel the host interference in this context. Then a robust and high-fidelity audio watermarking scheme based on the extended ISS with a psychoacoustic model is proposed. Experimental results show that the proposed scheme is robust against most of the common attacks while preserving high audio quality.
paper_title: Robust Audio Watermarking Based on Extended Improved Spread Spectrum with Perceptual Masking
